intro: Androcymbium gramineum, commonly known as the grassy androcymbium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often in wet meadows or along stream banks. Its reproductive structures are adapted for wind pollination, a common trait among grasses. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
